instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at loading OS
threads.message:
Customer brought in <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> which was not loading system. I have noticed, that computer had Fusion Drive configured with SSD and HDD in optical drive bay. I took out both, put new SSD and cable, installed new Catalina which went smooth, but in the end computer started restarting. It was loading OS to arround 75% and turning off. I've Instpected board - looks perfect, no corrosion, dust, no damaged components. I have tried other HDD cable, other SSD, tried booting from external drive, changed RAM, tried with different slots, disconnected everything except LCD and trackpad - everything ends up with progress bar stuck at 30% or 75% (depening which version of OS I'm trying to run). I have already tried known good BIOS and new BIOS chip with no results. Verbose mode shows me such error (pic 0043). When trying to run ASD it shows another error (pic 0044)... Any ideas?

EDIT: Computer has cracked glass, but customer claims it hasn't fell down. Maybe It's worth performing CPU/PCH reflow?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at loading OS
threads.message:
Cab be CPU, or RAM issue.
Try to load Windows/Linux Live.
